remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下，听写语法不会使用特定的单词或字顺序来识别和解释音频输入。By default, the dictation grammar does not make use of specific words or word order to identify and interpret audio input. 向听写语法添加上下文时，识别引擎将使用 `precedingText` 和 `subsequentText` 来确定何时将语音解释为听写。When a context is added to a dictation grammar, the recognition engine uses the `precedingText` and `subsequentText` to identify when to interpret speech as dictation. > [!NOTE] > 听写语法必须由 或 对象加载，然后才能使用 来添加上下文。A dictation grammar must be loaded by a or object before you can use to add a context. 下表描述了识别引擎如何使用这两个参数来确定何时使用听写语法。The following table describes how the recognition engine uses the two parameters to determine when to use the dictation grammar. |`precedingText`|`subsequentText`|说明Description| |---------------------|----------------------|-----------------| |非 `null`not `null`|非 `null`not `null`|识别引擎使用这些条款来括上可能的候选短语。The recognition engine uses the terms to bracket possible candidate phrases.| |`null`|非 `null`not `null`|识别引擎使用 `subsequentText` 完成听写。The recognition engine uses the `subsequentText` to finish dictation.| |非 `null`not `null`|`null`|识别引擎使用 `precedingText` 启动听写。The recognition engine uses the `precedingText` to start dictation.| |`null`|`null`|使用听写语法时，识别引擎不使用上下文。The recognition engine does not use a context when using the dictation grammar.|
